pageContext.claim: “Now, with all of that, had we not done the big raise on interest, I think we would have been close to 4%, and I -- could see 5,000 to 10,000 points more on the Dow. But that was a killer when they raised the rate. It was just a big mistake.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump promised to achieve 4 percent annual growth in the gross domestic product but fell far short of that in his first three years. Without evidence, he blames the Federal Reserve for thwarting his goal -- which virtually every economist said was unrealistic.
